title: The Lambton Worm
description: The Lambton Worm is a modern re-telling of the popular story from old English folklore. When a young John Lambton skips church to go fishing, he catches something unnatural. Fearful of his father's reaction to both skipping church and bringing such a foul creature to the house - he throws it in the well. Years later, after fighting in the Crusades, John returns home to an unwanted surprise. When all seems lost, and he seems doomed to die - he finds help from a most unexpected person. This is a short story, approx 6000 words including the footnotes. The actual story is approx 5800 words.
author: Martyn Stanley
